newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Bligh says encounters major gas zone.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Bligh says encounters major gas zone.

text.p: Bligh Oil and Minerals NL said on Tuesday it had encountered a major gas zone in the first well drilled in the Morrow gas play in Texas.
Bligh said it was not possible to accurately estimate gas reserves until production testing and pressure build-up analysis had been completed.
"However, gas reserves in comparable wells in the immediate area range from 20-50 billion cubic feet of gas per well," it said in a statement.
The pay section in the Fleetwood well was one of the thickest known in that portion of the Anadarko basin, it said.
The top of the reservoir was encountered at 4,620.5 metres and the base at 4,673.9 metrees for a gross thickness of 53.4 metres. Net pay within the section amounted to 51 metres.
Bligh said it expected the well to be completed for testing before year-end, with a view to starting continuous production in the first quarter of 1997.
Three additional drillsites had been identified on the West Park block and further drilling was expected in the first quarter of next year.
The Fleetwood No. 1-16 well is the first of a programme of deep tests planned by Bligh on its holdings in the Anadarko Basin.
The second well, the Thomas Meek No. 1, is curently being drilled 20 km to the west.
Bligh said wells of the apparent quality of Fleetwood Trust No.1-16 "have the potential to make major contributions to Bligh's cash flow" even at lower levels of working interest.

Bligh has a 25 percent interest in the West Park project. Operator Kerr-McGee Corp has 50 percent, Beartooth Exploration Partners LP 13.75 percent, William A Gruy 1.25 percent, Omega Oil NL 5.00 percent, and Robert C and Gwynneth F Weiss 5.0 percent.
Shares in Bligh were 5.5 cents stronger at 29 cents at 1.10 p.m. (0210 GMT).
